channel.title: My Source Automatically Closes When i try to Open It (Windows 7)
channel.description: Okay so like i said i use windows 7, and i DO have the converter but the problem is whenever i open the source it automatically closes i dont know if it has something to do with the paths or classpaths or if the code for it is all wrong but all i know is some of the error (because it closes so fast) here it is... Cannot find C:\programfiles\java\jre6\jib\???\???? <could not read all of it :\ The codes for the path and class path would be appreciated, also see if you can help.

item.title: My Source Automatically Closes When i try to Open It (Windows 7)
item.dc:creator: @s_p_i_d_a_z s p i d a z
item.description:
@s_p_i_d_a_z wrote:

[quote=“s p i d a z, post:12, topic:351155”][quote author=deathschaos9 link=topic=447511.msg3284527#msg3284527 date=1280105599]
If you have Java installed, set your environmental variables.

[quote]
[center]Setting up your Environmental Variables[/center]

Environmental variables are what allows you to run your server with Java, without it you would simple get ‘The path is not yet specified’ so this is an extremely important step. We will firstly open ‘My Computer’ and click ‘View System Information’. As you do this, a small applet displaying several tabs, and you will select the one that says ‘Advanced’ and at the bottom, click ‘Environmental Variables’. Now what you’re going to do, is go to your ‘Path’ and ‘Classpath’ variables and edit them.

In your Classpath variable, you’re going to take everything currently inside it and edit it with your latest version of JDK, so right now it would be;

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Though if a newer version comes out, you would change the ‘jdk1.6.0_11’ to the newest version.

After you have done the Classpath variable, you’re going to find the Path variable and add the code below inside it.

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;

The same goes for Path, if you download a newer version of JDK then you’re going to change the ‘jdk1.6.0_11’ to your current version.[/quote]
[/quote][/quote]

read this please. Its been posted 3 times.

Read full topic

title Pk Planet
Start java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server
exit[/quote]

that works fine, Your environmental settings are messed up, Or you changed something in server.java

item.dc:creator: @s_p_i_d_a_z s p i d a z
item.description:
@s_p_i_d_a_z wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:8, topic:351155”]If you have Java installed, set your environmental variables.

[quote]
[center]Setting up your Environmental Variables[/center]

Environmental variables are what allows you to run your server with Java, without it you would simple get ‘The path is not yet specified’ so this is an extremely important step. We will firstly open ‘My Computer’ and click ‘View System Information’. As you do this, a small applet displaying several tabs, and you will select the one that says ‘Advanced’ and at the bottom, click ‘Environmental Variables’. Now what you’re going to do, is go to your ‘Path’ and ‘Classpath’ variables and edit them.

In your Classpath variable, you’re going to take everything currently inside it and edit it with your latest version of JDK, so right now it would be;

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Though if a newer version comes out, you would change the ‘jdk1.6.0_11’ to the newest version.

After you have done the Classpath variable, you’re going to find the Path variable and add the code below inside it.

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;

The same goes for Path, if you download a newer version of JDK then you’re going to change the ‘jdk1.6.0_11’ to your current version.[/quote][/quote]

item.title: My Source Automatically Closes When i try to Open It (Windows 7)
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

If you have Java installed, set your environmental variables.

[center][b]Setting up your Environmental Variables[/b][/center]

Environmental variables are what allows you to run your server with Java, without it you would simple get ‘The path is not yet specified’ so this is an extremely important step. We will firstly open ‘My Computer’ and click ‘View System Information’. As you do this, a small applet displaying several tabs, and you will select the one that says ‘Advanced’ and at the bottom, click ‘Environmental Variables’. Now what you’re going to do, is go to your ‘Path’ and ‘Classpath’ variables and edit them.

In your Classpath variable, you’re going to take everything currently inside it and edit it with your latest version of JDK, so right now it would be;

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Though if a newer version comes out, you would change the ‘jdk1.6.0_11’ to the newest version.

After you have done the Classpath variable, you’re going to find the Path variable and add the code below inside it.

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;

The same goes for Path, if you download a newer version of JDK then you’re going to change the ‘jdk1.6.0_11’ to your current version.

Read full topic
